brief_summary.textblock:
A clinical study to determine the efficacy and safety of an Treatment of MK0869 in the
      treatment of depression.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Patients With Major Depressive Disorder With MK0869 (0869-061)(COMPLETED)

detailed_description.textblock: The duration of treatment is 8 weeks.

clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Multicenter, Placebo-and Active-Controlled Acute and Extension Study of 2 Doses of MK-0869 in the Treatment of Patients With Major Depressive Disorder

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: HAMD-17 total score at week 8. Tolerability.

reference.citation: Keller M, Montgomery S, Ball W, Morrison M, Snavely D, Liu G, Hargreaves R, Hietala J, Lines C, Beebe K, Reines S. Lack of Efficacy of the Substance P (Neurokinin(1) Receptor) Antagonist Aprepitant in the Treatment of Major Depressive Disorder. Biol Psychiatry. 2005 Oct 21; [Epub ahead of print]
Liu KS, Snavely DB, Ball WA, Lines CR, Reines SA, Potter WZ. Is bigger better for depression trials? J Psychiatr Res. 2008 Jul;42(8):622-30. Epub 2007 Sep 7.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.name_title: Vice President, Late Stage Development Group Leader

secondary_outcome.measure: CGI-I score at week 8, at least 50% reduction in the HAMD-17 total score, and Sheehan Disability Score at Week 8

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment
